diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: common bile duct dilatation, duodenal arteriovenous malformation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with right lower quadrant abdominal pain and nausea, and imaging studies (CT scan and RUQ ultrasound) showed dilation of the common bile duct and pancreatic duct, along with indications of fat stranding, which are suggestive of acute pancreatitis. She was planned for ERCP due to these findings.
